title: Emilia Clarke poses in Game Of Thrones reunion snap with Jason Momoa and Kit Harrington
text:
She was romantically involved with both of them on Game Of Thrones.

And Emilia Clarke was reunited with her on-screen lovers Jason Momoa and Kit Harrington on Saturday as she posted a cute snap of the three of them on her Instagram account as they enjoyed a mini-reunion for her birthday.

The actress, 33, who played Queen Daenerys Targaryen in the long-running show, beamed as she was embraced by Jason, 40, and Kit, 32, who played Khal Drogo and Jon Snow in the show which concluded earlier this year.

Fun times: Emilia Clarke, 33, was reunited with fellow Game Of Thrones stars Jason Momoa, 40, and Kit Harrington, 32, on Saturday as she posed with the three of them

Aquaman star Jason's arms lay across the shoulders of both Emilia and Kit, with Emilia holding his arm warmly as she smiled.

The Last Christmas star alluded to both Jason and Kit's lengthy locks and beards as she wrote in a caption beside the post: 'Reunions never looked this hairy.'

Emilia showed off a patterned shirt which was tucked into a pair of smart midnight blue trousers.

Her Game Of Thrones character was forced to marry Jason's Khal Drogo, but she then fell in love with him before the character's death.

Change of heart: Game Of Thrones character Daenerys Targaryen was forced to marry Jason's Khal Drogo, but she then fell in love with him before the character's death

Betrayal: Daenerys then went on to fall in love with Kit's character Jon Snow before he killed her in the last episode of the final season

Daenerys then went on to join forces and fall in love with Kit's character Jon Snow before he killed her in the last episode of the final season.

It comes after Emilia said on The Graham Norton show that she started crying when she met Beyoncé at the singer's Oscars after party because she was 'too many drinks in'.

The Game Of Thrones star said the pop icon, 38, 'got out of there very quickly' when she burst into tears at her bash because she was overwhelmed.

Speaking to Graham Norton, in scenes that aired on Friday, Emilia laughed about the moment she says she unexpectedly bumped into Jay-Z and Beyoncé.

Emotional: Emilia Clarke, 33, told Graham Norton that Beyoncé, 38, 'got out of there very quickly' when she burst into tears at her Oscars after party earlier this year

Icon: Emilia laughed about the moment she says she unexpectedly bumped into Jay-Z and Beyoncé (pictured in July)

'I did not expect to see them in the flesh. I wasn't expecting that at all, I was just amazed to be invited,' she said.

'I was like, "How did that happen?" When I met Queen Bey I was too many drinks in and started crying. It didn't go well. I think she got out of there very quickly!'

She went on to talk about her friends' lack of interest in her Game Of Thrones success - after she rose to fame through eight seasons as Daenerys Targaryen.

Unsupportive: She went on to talk about her friends' lack of interest in her Game Of Thrones success - after she rose to fame through eight seasons

Hungover: Talking about her new film, Last Christmas, Emilia described being 'in a perpetual sort of hangover state' during 'bonkers' filming in central London from 12pm until midday

Unwell: Emilia suffered from two brain aneurysms during filming for Game Of Thrones - with the first hitting while she was working out with her personal trainer aged 24

'It started with things like, "We can't afford to stream Game of Thrones, we don't have the money, sorry Emilia," then it was, "We'll try and download it," then it was season eight and I was having a screening of the last episode and they said, "So we've seven and three quarter seasons to catch up before this Sunday!"

Talking about her new film, Last Christmas, Emilia described being 'in a perpetual sort of hangover state' during 'bonkers' filming in central London from 12pm until midday.

'Filming at Christmas in London last year was bonkers. Because we were in Covent Garden and Regent Street, we started at midnight and finished at midday and I was in a perpetual sort of hangover state,' she added.
